body: This manga from many years ago brings back memories, I'm glad you reuploaded it to English, thank you very much for the content uwu/
I'd honestly love this as a full serious manga series (sfw even), this was really nice

Change H is a pretty good magazine for stories involving playing with gender norms, and Amazume Ryuuta is especially fantastic in it.
He's not just that guy who does an S&M series.

@reigovassal
I do not think Rinko was considering being trans, I am fairly certain it was only about the effort in being 'feminine'. She wanted to quit the rigamarole of putting on makeup and dieting and whatnot to be presentable to society, evidenced by her nostalgia for her highschool days.
But then she sees the effort that those boys went through, also not because they are trans but because they idolize that ideal femininity that media can present, and desired to capture it and share it with others, even if only for a brief moment. To that end, Nobuo goes through his exercises and layers of clothing to obscure his masculinity during that brief time he puts on a show, even staying silent the entire time. It is not about himself, it is about the feminine ideal they brought out of the anime in the form of Elerin.
The ending is Rinko being inspired to renew her efforts, since she merely has to maintain what she (a female) already has.
Hah... Sometimes I wonder why I feel God forsaken my action. Now I know..
My god that first page made me think this is another human skin type hentai. Thank god it's different
Same author with that S&M soft manga? I forgot the name

For anyone that still confused by the ending, here's my interpretation. She's probably late 20's and doesn't feel she's being a "woman" and having thought to trans when she monologue "should I quit being a  woman." At the end of the manga she change her mind completely and decide to be a woman since she's already "doing that for 20 years."
Why is this on a hentai site?
dun dun dun dun dun dun dun du du dun. Amogus
